title: Russia Is Selling Nuclear Reactors to India; U.S. Protests
description: Russia's cash-starved nuclear establishment is planning to sell two nuclear reactors to India, a move that has prompted protests from Washington.

title: A Modern Building's Timeless Soul
description: Few pieces of important spiritual architecture are made in these times. Fewer still come into being as a result of drama and intrigue worthy of a detective story. But the Byzantine Fresco Chapel, which is scheduled to open on Saturday on a quiet residential street here, ranks as one of the most ambitious small religious buildings of recent years. And it came to be because of some stolen art, a notable philanthropist's determination to discover its origins, and her luck at being able to rescue and restore it before the thieves' agents could sell it off piecemeal.

title: Lawmaker Sees a Gain for His Fight Against Abortions Overseas
description: A chief Congressional opponent of abortion contended tonight that he had the votes for House passage of a ban on Federal money for groups that perform abortions overseas, even if they were using private money for that purpose.

title: 2 Top Hong Kong Officials Fault China's New Policies
description: Even as China moves to revoke a range of laws protecting civil liberties here, two of Hong Kong's most senior officials have begun to speak out against Chinese interference in the territory's affairs.

title: Two Proto-Feminists Remember Weimar
description: The documentary ''Ringl and Pit,'' completed in 1995 by Juan Mandelbaum, has been quietly attracting attention and praise, largely through an international network of screenings in museums and festivals. Tonight it can be seen on WNET. There's no reason to be quiet anymore.

title: Paid Notice: Memorials  GORMAN, ETHEL
description: GORMAN-Ethel. We miss your warmth, your caring, and your humor. You're always in our minds and in our hearts. Love, Linda, Doug, Abby and Richard

title: Apple Chief Executive Seeks More Time to Aid Company
description: Gilbert F. Amelio gave the best speech of his one-year tenure as chief executive of Apple Computer Inc. today, persuading frustrated shareholders to give him more time to turn around the troubled computer company.

title: O'Bannon Finds a Fit In an Unlikely Spot
description: Maybe he could be a history teacher, and just disappear like chalk dust, a complete fade from fame. And maybe that would be all right one day.

title: CUNY's New Offering: Quick Guide to Citizenship
description: In the face of plans to cut government benefits for legal immigrants, the City University of New York will try to help thousands of its immigrant students become citizens.

title: CHRONICLE
description: ELIZABETH TAYLOR will have surgery to remove a benign brain tumor, but first she will celebrate her 65th birthday with a black-tie gala to raise money for AIDS, The Associated Press reported yesterday.

title: Paid Notice: Deaths  KRASSNER, RUTH FRIEDWALD (NEE WEINSTEIN)
description: KRASSNER-Ruth Friedwald (nee Weinstein), Hollywood, FL, Feb. 4. Beloved wife of Irving Krassner & the late Samuel Friedwald. Loving mother of Herbert and Frank (Nancy) Friedwald, Joan (John) Exenkamper, Marjory Tracy. Dear sister of Edith (Murray) Beldock. Cherished grandmother of 9. Services Beth Moses Cemetery, Pinelawn, LI, 11 AM, Friday. Donations may be made to Hospice Foundation, 777 17 Street, Room 401, Miami Beach, Florida 33139.

title: Paid Notice: Deaths  CARBERRY, HELEN M. (NEE BOYLAN)
description: CARBERRY-Helen M. (nee Boylan), on February 5, 1997. Beloved wife of Charles. Devoted mother of Charles M., Carol Usiak, Cheryl Gay and Kelly Feeney. Dear sister of Joan Gronne. Loving grandmother of ten. Reposing at Denis S. O'Connor Funeral Home, 91-05 Beach Channel Drive, Rockaway Beach, NY. Mass of Christian Burial on Saturday, 9:30 AM, at St. Rose of Lima Church. Interment St. Charles Cemetery. Visiting Thursday 7-10 PM, Friday 2-5, 7-10.

title: Corrections
description: A report in the Daily Briefing column in New Jersey copies on Jan. 27 about a resolution by the Episcopal Diocese of Newark on same-sex unions misstated the content. It urged the General Convention of the national Episcopal Church to develop a rite for blessing ''committed relationships'' between people of the same sex, to be used at the discretion of the clergy; the diocese did not itself approve a standard liturgy for these unions, and did not refer to them as same-sex marriages.

title: Suspect Caught at a Casino
description: Victor A. Cardarelli had a quick errand to perform, so he left his warning lights on when he parked in front of the Resorts Casino Hotel in Atlantic City on Tuesday night, the authorities said yesterday. But when Mr. Cardarelli tried to withdraw $236 from his account at the hotel, an alert cashier stalled him until the police arrived, said John Hagerty, a spokesman for the State Police.

title: Corrections
description: An article on Tuesday about Norman Mailer's coming novel about Jesus referred incorrectly to the Bible translation that its style is said to echo faintly. It is the King James Version, not St. James.

title: Nothing Says a Global Economy Is Inevitable
description: To the Editor:

title: Paid Notice: Deaths  KALIFOWICZ, HANA
description: KALIFOWICZ-Hana. Dear mother of Roslyn (Reyzl) KalifowiczWaletzky, son-in-law Josh, grandchildren, David and Judith. Funeral 2/6, 2 P.M., Parkside Memorial Chapel, 2576 Flatbush Ave, B'klyn.

title: Paid Notice: Deaths  KAY, SYLVIA
description: KAY-Sylvia, 76, on February 3. Beloved wife of William. Loving mother of Nathalie, Harvey and Ira. Cherished grandmother of David, Stuart, Scott, Sarah, Benjamin, Lorin, Jonathan. Special motherin-law to Joan, Barry and Carol and special aunt to Bruce and Robert. She was the matriarch of our family, a loving and beloved woman, who will be forever missed.

title: Paid Notice: Deaths  LAZAR, HELEN B.
description: LAZAR-Helen B. The leadership and staff of UJA-Federation of NY mourn the passing of Helen B. Lazar, beloved wife of the late Jack Lazar. Through the Lazar Foundation, of which Mrs. Lazar was a trustee and her son, William, is a trustee, the family's generous gifts improve the lives of numerous New Yorkers and Jews worldwide. To her children, grandchildren, and the entire family, we send our deepest condolences. May her memory be for a blessing. Larry A. Silverstein, Board Chair Louise B. Greilsheimer, President Stephen D. Solender, Exec. V.P.

title: The Pop Life
description: Pavement's Plan

title: Schism of the Union
description: Oh, what a night.

title: NEWS SUMMARY
description: INTERNATIONAL A3-13

title: Reading the Message in the Bottles
description: Tressa Prisbrey had a simple explanation for why she spent 26 years trucking back and forth to the garbage dump in her Studebaker pickup to create a luminescent village made of one and a half million discarded bottles.

title: Paid Notice: Deaths  KAPLAN, LESTER
description: KAPLAN-Lester. The Board of Governors and members of Montammy Golf Club express their deepest sorrow at the passing of their beloved member and extend their heartfelt sympathy to Gladys and the entire family. Stanley Plonchak, President

title: Pacers Lose McKey
description: Indiana Pacers forward DERRICK McKEY will miss several weeks with a stress fracture of his left foot incurred in Tuesday's loss to Orlando.

title: May the Best Prefontaine Win
description: Next fall, moviegoers may do a double take when, for the second time this year, a film about the late track star Steve Prefontaine will be released.

title: Safety Before Beauty
description: To The Home Section:

title: A Glimmer of Democracy in Serbia
description: Slobodan Milosevic is a wily, unforgiving politician, and his opponents in Serbia are wise to wonder about his intent in belatedly agreeing to honor last November's municipal election results. After weeks of daily protest demonstrations in Belgrade, Mr. Milosevic ended his Government's effort to nullify opposition victories in 14 cities and towns. But his action, while welcome, does not transform Serbia into a democracy or end the political crisis there.

title: A Poll of AIDS Doctors Finds That Many Help in Suicides
description: Dr. Stephen O'Brien, an AIDS specialist, said today that the question of suicide was never far from the minds of his patients who were suffering from some of the terrible effects of AIDS.

title: Football Guessing Game Is Over As Recruits Sign Letters of Intent
description: Although his decision was made on Halloween, Michael Hart, a 6-foot-7-inch, 220-pound tight end from Sayville, L.I., could not disguise his excitement yesterday. It was signing day, the first day that 1997 college football recruits could turn their oral commitments into written ones, and Hart officially committed himself to attend Duke next season.

title: Record Labels Bypassing Store Policies on Lyrics
description: Are some record companies pulling a fast one on Wal-Mart, Kmart and other retail chains?

title: 4 Britons Recalled From Nigeria in Visa-Selling Investigation
description: At least four British employees of the visa section of the British High Commission here have been sent home in recent weeks because of what diplomats suspect is a major visa-selling ring.

title: When Money Counts
description: THE challenge was to find dining room chairs in various shapes and sizes costing between $125 and $225. And the treasure hunt yielded many treasures. The materials ranged from cardboard (surprisingly, that was the most expensive -- $225) to rough-hewn bamboo ($125) to 150-year-old bird's-eye maple ($200) to shiny white plastic ($195).

title: A Setback on Death Row
description: John M. Martini, the death row inmate who wants to be executed, lost another round in his legal battle yesterday when the New Jersey Supreme Court sent the case back to the trial court for another hearing. The latest skirmish concerns information that the Office of the Public Defender wants to use to overturn his sentence but that Mr. Martini has insisted be confidential. The high court ordered Judge Bruce A. Gaeta of the Superior Court in Bergen County to weigh whether this material should have been considered during the penalty phase of his murder trial. If so, the court said, Judge Gaeta should decide whether the omission constituted a ''manifest injustice'' against Mr. Martini.

title: Caller ID Gains, Despite Limitation
description: BECAUSE she lived alone and worried about receiving annoying or obscene telephone calls, Patricia Dunn of Bloomfield, N.J., signed up for Caller ID five years ago, soon after her local phone company began offering the service.

title: U.S. Voices Its Concern on Civil War in Zaire
description: The United States is growing increasingly concerned that the civil war in eastern Zaire is intensifying, drawing in guerrilla forces from neighboring countries, displacing thousands of refugees and threatening to further destabilize Zaire, officials said today.

title: Official Honored
description: The United States Golf Association presented its highest honor, the Bob Jones Award, to FRED BRAND JR. of Sewickley, Pa., during its annual meeting last weekend at Portland, Ore. Brand, 87, has officiated at 30 United States Opens, three Ryder Cups and 37 Masters. Currently in his 35th year on the PGA National Advisory Board, Brand is the 44th recipient of the award.

title: Success of Venture Hinges On a Low-Key Executive
description: The man who will head the nation's biggest securities firm has spent more than a decade shunning the ways of Wall Street.

title: Blending Exercise and Education at Natural History Museum
description: One by one, they slipped into the shuttered American Museum of Natural History under the cover of darkness yesterday morning, their Reeboks and Nikes slapping the marble floors and echoing through the cavernous rotunda. Shucking their outerwear, they lined up and inhaled deeply. And then, in an unparalleled greeting of the dawn breaking over Manhattan, they raised their arms to the giant mother Barosaurus -- and brought those arms down and up, up and down for a jumping jack ode to the world-famous skeleton.

title: With Merged Strength Comes Conflict With Retail Brokerage Houses
description: By combining Dean Witter's national network of retail stockbrokers with Morgan Stanley's investment skill, yesterday's merger should significantly strengthen the new company's mutual fund offerings. But it will create conflicts among people who sell the funds.

title: Ewing, Still Injured, Quits All-Star Roster
description: Patrick Ewing has joined the growing list of players who will be unable to play in Sunday's National Basketball Association All-Star Game.

title: Paid Notice: Deaths  KASSEL, ALVIN L.
description: KASSEL-Alvin L. Best friend and cherished husband of Doris. Most devoted, gentle and kind father to Bonnie, Kal and Kim. Died peacefully at his home on Feb. 5, 1997. The memory of your bright blue eyes, brilliant mind, quick wit and exceptional sensitivity will never be forgotten. How desperately we will miss you and how completely we love you now and always.

title: Paid Notice: Deaths  BOZZA, JOHN J. JR.
description: BOZZA-John J. Jr., suddenly on February 3, 1997 of San Diego, CA. (Formerly of East Northport and Farmingdale, NY). Beloved son of Patricia K. Bozza. Devoted son of John J. Bozza Sr. Dear brother of Kathleen Galvin, Michael Bozza, Trina McGrath, and Jannet Bozza. Proud uncle of five. Loving stepson of Regina, fond stepbrother of Elliot and Eric. Reposing at the Fredrick J. Chapey & Sons East Islip Funeral Home, 200 East Main Street (1/2 mile west of S.S. Parkway, Exit 45W). Celebration of the Liturgy of Christian Burial, St. John Nepomucene R.C. Church, Bohemia, Saturday 9:45 A.M. Cremation, Washington Memorial Park, Coram, Long Island. Visiting Thursday 7-9:30 P.M. and Friday 2-4:30 and 7-9:30 P.M.

title: From an Apprenticeship With O.J. to a Court TV Host
description: The latest celebrity to make it to prime-time television is Johnnie L. Cochran Jr., best known to viewers for his performance as O. J. Simpson's lawyer in the, alas, unforgettable criminal trial. Mr. Cochran is now co-host with Nancy Grace, a former Atlanta prosecutor, on a nightly Court TV talk show that owes a little something to ''Crossfire.''

title: Somali Immigrant Had Won Asylum Before Detention
description: Megan Abdullah Jama, who was released this week after spending almost a month in the immigration detention center here, concedes that he was treated well, allowed to practice his faith and had relatively easy access to his lawyer.

title: Royal Pitchwoman
description: To the Editor:

title: Gretzky Gets Riled, And the Whalers Pay
description: Kevin Haller should have known better.

Mother of Marie Vitale, Patrica O'Prey, Elizabeth Gregory, Joseph and James. Grandmother of Kevin, Trish and Raymond O'Prey and Patrick G. Kennedy. Reposing Fri. 6-9 P.M. at Thomas C. Montera Funeral Home, 1848 Westchester Ave., Bronx. Mass Saturday, 9:45 A.M. Church of St. Raymond. Interment St. Raymond Cemetery.

title: Senate Easily Confirms Slater As Transportation Secretary
description: Rodney Slater, who headed the State Highway Commission in Arkansas when Bill Clinton was Governor there, was confirmed today as Secretary of Transportation.
